1.SceneDescription:
The beach house, it’s the same scene from the end of last year, with Ross
in front of the two doors of Rachel’s and Bonnie’s rooms, trying to decide which
door to choose. He finally chooses the one his right and goes in.

lines.Line: Rachel was just helping me out. My head got all sunburned
(getting up and leaving) (to Ross) Okay, I’ll see you in our room
Yeah. (closes the door, and goes over and kisses Rachel.

lines.Character: (They both kiss again and fall onto the bed
lines.Line: They both kiss again and fall onto the bed.
(stopping suddenly and getting up) Okay, I gotta go
Well, I-I gotta go break up with Bonnie

Well, yeah. I can’t-I can’t stay here all night, and if I go in
there she’s-she’s gonna wanna... do stuff
Well, can’t you tell her that you are not in the mood

No, she likes that. Yeah. Faking sleep doesn’t work either, I
can’t tell you how many mornings I woke up with her..
Whoa-oh, okay! Yeah, why am I telling you that
Yeah, yeah. (opens the door) It wasn’t every morning

2.SceneDescription:
The beach house, Joey and Chandler are sitting at the dinner table, Monica is
looking in the fridge.

lines.Line: (closing the fridge in disgust) Shoot! We’re out of soda
(jumping up) Oh, I’ll go out and get you some

Nope! Because I’m not your boyfriend. (to Phoebe, who’s
entering) Hey Pheebs, how did it go
Well, umm, my Mom’s friend, Phoebe, is actually my birth Mom
I found a dried up seashores
Sweety, what are you talking about
Sweety, what are you talking about

Oh, my new Mom, who-who’s a big, fat abandoner! (starts to go
upstairs

Whoa, wait, Pheebs, wait a second! Don’t you wanna stay here and talk
about it
No. I’m just, I wanna, I need to be alone
No. I’m just, I wanna, I need to be alone

3.SceneDescription:
The beach house, the next morning. Ross is passed out on the kitchen counter.
He wakes up with a start and has one of the pages of the letter stuck to his face.

lines.Line:
Oh. (looks at his watch) Oh-oh. (takes a drink of coffee and resumes
reading the letter

(coming down the stairs) Hey! (Ross jumps up, and quickly puts the
letter back together, pretending like he has just finished it.) What happened to you? Why
didn’t you come up

Well, I wanted to be thorough. I mean this-this is clearly very, very
important to you, to us! And so I wanted to read every word carefully, twice

Does it? Does it? Yeah, I wanted to give that whole ‘Does it?’
part just another glance

What are you talking about, Ross, you just said that you read it twice!
Look, y'know what, either it does or it doesn’t, and if you have to even think
about it..

(interrupting) No, Rach, no. I don’t, I don’t, I don’t have
to think about it, in fact, I’ve decided, I’ve decided that, that it.......does

lines.Character:
(Rachel stands there for a moment, starting to cry. Then gasps and runs over and hugs
him. While hugging her, Ross tries to find the ‘Does it?’ part in the letter
lines.Line:
Rachel stands there for a moment, starting to cry. Then gasps and runs over and hugs
him. While hugging her, Ross tries to find the ‘Does it?’ part in the letter.

I know. (Hugs him more violently this time and pushes him back away from
the letter.

4.SceneDescription: The beach house, Phoebe is coming down the stairs all packed and ready to go.

lines.Line:
Well, I’m ready to get the hell out of here! (Sees Ross and Rachel
cuddling on the couch.) Oh. Are you? Are you?!! (they nod ‘Yes.’) Ohh!
That’s so great!! Ooh, not for Bonnie. (they nod ‘No.’) But for you, yay!
Ohh

lines.Character: (The rest of the gang arrives with their heads down in shame
lines.Line: The rest of the gang arrives with their heads down in shame.
Nothing. I’m gonna take a shower
Okay, I’m gonna put this (her suitcase) in the car
Ooh, I have to go pack. (Gets up to do so.) It really does
It does. It really and truly does
It does. It really and truly does

lines.Character:
(Rachel kisses him, and goes upstairs. After she’s gone, Ross frantically tries to
find and read the ‘Does it?’ part
lines.Line:
Rachel kisses him, and goes upstairs. After she’s gone, Ross frantically tries to
find and read the ‘Does it?’ part.
(finding the part) (looks up in disgust) It so does not!!

5.SceneDescription: A hallway in an apartment building. Phoebe is knocks on a door and it opens.

lines.Line: (to the person that answered the door) Hi, Ursula

Okay, well umm, I know that we haven’t talked in a long time, but
umm okay, our Mom is not our birth Mom. This-this other lady is our birth Mom
Right, okay, the one that lives in Montuak, umm-hmm
No, I umm, I read about her in Mom’s suicide note

There-there was a suicide note?! (Ursula nods ‘Yes.’) Well, do
you still have it

(disgusted) Hang on. (She goes into her apartment and slams the door in
Phoebe’s face.
I can’t believe you didn’t tell me there was a suicide note
I can’t believe you didn’t tell me there was a suicide note
Yeah. So how have you been doing

lines.Character: (Ursula opens the door and hands her the note
lines.Line: Ursula opens the door and hands her the note.

(reading from the note) “Good-bye Phoebe and Ursula. I’ll miss
you. P.S. Your Mom lives in Montauk.” You just wrote this

Well, it’s pretty much the gist. Well, except for the poem. You
read the poem, right

All right, hang on! (She takes the note, goes back into her apartment
and slams the door shut.

6.SceneDescription: Central Perk, Phoebe is finishing up a song.

lines.Line:
(singing) “...fuchsia and mauvvve. Those are the 66 colours of my
bedroommmm.” (applause) Thank you, thank you. Ohh, and I invite you to count the
colours in your bedroom. (Sees that Phoebe Sr. has entered, and to her) Except for you.
You go away

I’ll go in a second, I-I just wanted to tell you that there
hasn’t been a day where I didn’t regret giving you up

No, I’m not done. I-I-I just want you to know that I, the
reason I didn’t look you up was, well I was afraid that you’d react, just well
like, the way, the way you’re reacting right now, and can’t we just, y'know,
start from here

Sorry. But just one last thing. Y'know you came looking for family.
I’m family, I’m it. Now, now I’m done. (starts to leave
But, it’s not like we’re losing anything. Y'know

It’s not like we-we know each other or anything. Or that have anything
in common

Well, I don’t know. I mean it’s not like we don’t
have anything in common. I mean I like uh, pizza
You do?! Wait, I like umm, the Beetles
Oh my God, so do I
Oh my God, so do I
Wait-wait-wait, wait! Puppies. Cute or ugly
Uh-huh, well! But umm, still I’m-I’m mad at you
I know. I’m mad at me too
I know. I’m mad at me too
Well umm, do you wanna get something to eat? I’m kinda hungry
All right, stop it. Now you’re just doing it to freak me out

7.SceneDescription:
Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Monica are playing cards at the dinner
table.

lines.Line:
We were playing Gin? Y'know if we were a couple, we could play this
game naked

Okay, all right, I think you’re great, I think you’re sweet,
and you’re smart, and I love you. But you will always be the guy who peed on me
